name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel LAX - El Segundo

reviews.title: TripAdvisor Reviews were right 'On the money'
reviews.text: In reading all of the reviews for a hotel near LAX that most guests enjoyed, this one property stood out as affordable and possibly the best choice. We stayed here for 2 nights going and coming from Thailand, and really enjoyed our stay here. The advertised 'comfy' beds were just that and the friendly check in, the warm and delicious cookie, airport shuttle, and super quiet rooms were great!

reviews.title: Best ever Park-and-Fly experience at LAX!
reviews.text: Only downside to my mind was a shuttle driver on coming back to the hotel for the second visit who didn't help get the luggage off the shuttle; and the rather expensive breakfasts. It is a comfortable walk to several coffee shops, an IHOP, Sizzler, McDonald's, a Ralph's supermarket, and some specialty restaurants which might be a better bet. We also walked to Manhattan Mall (about 2 miles return - but a welcome stretch after 19 hours in an airplane) which had some great shops and loads of restaurants (Coco's, California Pizza Kitchen, Chili's and several others). I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone looking for a great stay near LAX. I'd choose a different hotel on the beach in Marina del Ray if I were looking for a longer stay property to explore Los Angeles.

reviews.title: I've done my research, and Chose this hotel!
reviews.text: We've stayed at several hotels prior to departing from LAX, and this Doubletree was by far the best we've ever experienced.

reviews.title: loved the Doubletree
reviews.text: We paid about $180.00, which included 10 days of parking for our car and one of the best night's sleep we've ever had prior to a trip!

reviews.title: Best LAX option
reviews.text: It's a few miles away from the airport, which works in its favor because it's nice and quiet. The hotel is tucked into a corporate plaza type of setting .. and there was virtually NO noise at night.
This is a very nicely appointed DoubleTree. It is near LAX but far enough away so that we did not hear planes constantly overhead, it was really quiet. No traffic noises.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, especially as it is near an airport

likes.liked: — Comfy beds -- we needed a good night's sleep before traveling to DC
likes.disliked: — No complaints. I knew it was not near anything else but that was not an issue

reviews.text: We stayed a Friday and Saturday in the end of March. I would guess that on weekdays it is a very different atmosphere as it is surrounded by big businesses such as Mattel, Oracle, Xerox and such and is right next door to the Mattel daycare facility.
reviews.title: Great airport hotel!

reviews.text: There really is no place to walk to but who walks in LA? :o) We took the hotel shuttle to and from the airport with no major problems other than it was the start of spring break so the airport was a zoo.
reviews.title: Nice rooms, very comfortable beds for a brief stay!

reviews.text: The room was very nice and the beds and pillows were very comfortable! There is an asian feeling to the decor. We had a small fridge but no microwave. Nice neutrogena bath products supplied.
reviews.title: Suprised and happy with the Doubletree

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I ordered room service one night. It was good but overpriced. We ate breakfast in the on-site restaurant and it was okay, nothing fancy but decent.
reviews.title: Fine Airport Hotel

likes.liked: — Proximity to airport, but not too close

reviews.title: Nice hotel, great beds
reviews.text: Pros: The hotel is located in a business park just south of LAX. Offers free parking (which can cost $15 to $20 at hotels east of the airport).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice, clean rooms. Easy check in (with cookies).
reviews.title: Loved The Doubletree

reviews.text: The most comfortable beds I've ever slept in.
reviews.title: Perfect if on a stopover at LAX

likes.liked: — Newly renovated, clean, upscale, good staff
likes.disliked: — Nothing too much around the hotel

reviews.text: Convenient location (close to Manhattan Beach and I-105).
reviews.title: a pleasant surprise

likes.liked: — nice clean hotel with good facilities, close to LAX
likes.disliked: — location best suited to transit guests (its target market), would prefer to be closer to central LA for a vacation trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Free use of computers/Internet in lobby.
reviews.title: Excellent Value

likes.liked: — easy long term parking, convenient shuttle to airport

reviews.title: Nice airport hotel
reviews.text: Very helpfull staff, clean and big rooms. They even have a microwave oven in rooms, which I didn't know before I checked in. Easy to locate, ample parking, will stay here again. Easy drive to downtown LA.

reviews.title: A Very Comfortable Hotel for a Good Rest!
reviews.text: I've booked this hotel after reading alot of good reviews from tripadvisor.

reviews.title: Sweet hotel- and its not only the cookies!
reviews.text: Checking in was easy breezy! We were given a bag cookies each (very yummy!).

reviews.title: Mixed bag
reviews.text: When entered the room, were surprise to see a BIG and clean room, nice display, warm and comfortable lighting. Toilet is also neat and clean.

reviews.title: It was a great hotel with good prices (Great Location)
reviews.text: The best thing from this hotel should be the bed & pillows. They're ultra soft and so comfortable to sleep in!!!! We really had a good rest/sleep. There were no aircraft or traffic noise.
